intro: Epidendrum pachypodum, commonly known as the thick-stemmed epidendron, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year.
